intro: Gaylussacia brachycera, commonly known as the short-stemmed huckleberry, is a shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other acid-loving plants like blueberries and cranberries. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically red or black in color. Its leaves are alternate, oval, and have a leathery texture. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
